channel.title: Would you take a dance with Immortality?
channel.description:
Would you ever want to be immortal?
I would in a fucking heartbeat. I am not scared of death or anything of the sort. And, in a few centuries, I would get over the fact that people I know will die.

item.title: Would you take a dance with Immortality?
item.dc:creator: @slayer215 slayer215
item.description:
@slayer215 wrote:

[quote=“Cowie`, post:14, topic:272925”]I’d love to be immortal just for the fact I can experience anything and everything I want to without time playing a major aspect in things, as for the subject people keep on bringing up about death and being scared of it, I don’t see why anyone should be. Live your life to the full, do what you want and leave a corpse for the people who actual care about you and will do something about your death.[/quote][quote=“dragonfire455, post:1, topic:272925”]Would you ever want to be immortal?

I would in a fucking heartbeat. I am not scared of death or anything of the sort. And, in a few centuries, I would get over the fact that people I know will die.[/quote]

The fear of death is just like, if you were a hostage or something and some guy put a gun to your head you’d be like “NOOOOOOOO PLZ DONT KILL ME”, you wouldnt just sit there and be like whatever. I think the only people who dont fear death are like old people and crazy people.

But I dont think Id be immortal. Life would just get really boring and you’d have to have a job for forever unless you won the lottery or something. It would be kind of weird if you made your parents immortal too, but if you didnt youd prolly miss them a lot after they die. The only cool parts would be seeing technology advance so much and having the time to learn anything you wanted.

Read full topic
item.source: Would you take a dance with Immortality?

item.title: Would you take a dance with Immortality?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

So…

Would you tell people you were immortal? I don’t think I would.

Only reason I want to be immortal is to witness the end of the world.

Read full topic
item.source: Would you take a dance with Immortality?

item.title: Would you take a dance with Immortality?
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:22, topic:272925”]Depends if my body remained 18 years old.

If I aged then I’d hate it because I’d be stuck shrivelled up for eternity.[/quote]
thats what i thought at first but apparently in this instance you had a selective choice of your bodies age.
Another thing there would be soo many problems with this, back in medievil days woulda been fine but now. Think about it you have birth certificates, drivers licenses and so on. Eventually someone is gonna check a peice of identity you own and see you are xyz years old and you could end up on a scientists work bench

Read full topic
item.source: Would you take a dance with Immortality?

I’m Edward Cullen.

item.source: Would you take a dance with Immortality?

item.title: Would you take a dance with Immortality?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Creme de la Creme, post:19, topic:272925”][quote author=dragonfire455 link=topic=360240.msg2746157#msg2746157 date=1239644380]
What would happen if you could never die? (E.g. regenerate lost body parts)
[/quote]
But that’s just bullshit. Old age immortality is not prevented by any scientific laws, we just can’t do it. There’s also obviously always a risk of getting killed on the motorway, developing a fatal disease/syndrome, getting shot/bombed by terrorists and all the other random stuff that could happen to anyone.

So no, I wouldn’t be immortal because I believe old age is there for a reason - to stop your body degenerating of much worse causes like 500 years of background radiation.

If we’re in fairy land and the definition of immortality is to live forever in your current state, I’d love to be immortal. Think of all the knowledge, experience, money and power you could gain. You’d never get bored because as soon as you develop a psychological problem with it you can use 100’s of years of experience to have effective therapy.[/quote]
Meaning by immortality you also mean you don’t take any deadly damage or damage that cannot repaired?
Yes it would be nice, be a superhero since you can take risks other people can’t.

Read full topic
item.source: Would you take a dance with Immortality?

item.title: Would you take a dance with Immortality?
item.dc:creator: @Creme_de_la_Creme Creme de la Creme
item.description:
@Creme_de_la_Creme wrote:

dragonfire455:

What would happen if you could never die? (E.g. regenerate lost body parts)

But that’s just bullshit. Old age immortality is not prevented by any scientific laws, we just can’t do it. There’s also obviously always a risk of getting killed on the motorway, developing a fatal disease/syndrome, getting shot/bombed by terrorists and all the other random stuff that could happen to anyone.

So no, I wouldn’t be immortal because I believe old age is there for a reason - to stop your body degenerating of much worse causes like 500 years of background radiation.

If we’re in fairy land and the definition of immortality is to live forever in your current state, I’d love to be immortal. Think of all the knowledge, experience, money and power you could gain. You’d never get bored because as soon as you develop a psychological problem with it you can use 100’s of years of experience to have effective therapy.

Read full topic
item.source: Would you take a dance with Immortality?

item.title: Would you take a dance with Immortality?
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“dragonfire455, post:17, topic:272925”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=360240.msg2747156#msg2747156 date=1239697364]
what about age? i didnt think about this the first time round, but its all very well getting as old as time but if you’re body starts to age and gets weaker and your body parts become so weak they can’t support yourself you become a phlid that just sits in a bed all the time
[/quote]Your body would not age. You would remain the same age SELECTIVELY for all eternity.[/quote]
in which case i stick by my original post fuck yeah

Read full topic

item.title: Would you take a dance with Immortality?
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“cooper, post:2, topic:272925”]Maybe, but only if I could make some others immortal as well.[/quote]You could.

[quote=“jme, post:10, topic:272925”][quote author=g-stringer link=topic=360240.msg2745946#msg2745946 date=1239634180]
Meh, never. Even committing suicide would be impossible. I would definitely like some emergency button of some sort, just in case I get bored.
[/quote]

Suicide can’t be impossible. You wouldn’t be able to do this by yourself but what if you’re body was diced into a trillion little pieces, then soaked in gasoline and set to fire, and burned into ashes. I think you would be dead :P[/quote]What would happen if you could never die? (E.g. regenerate lost body parts)

Read full topic

item.title: Would you take a dance with Immortality?
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

I’d love to be immortal just for the fact I can experience anything and everything I want to without time playing a major aspect in things, as for the subject people keep on bringing up about death and being scared of it, I don’t see why anyone should be. Live your life to the full, do what you want and leave a corpse for the people who actual care about you and will do something about your death.

Read full topic
item.source: Would you take a dance with Immortality?

item.title: Would you take a dance with Immortality?
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:11, topic:272925”]When most people speak of immortality they mean they will never die of old age, but can still kill themselves/be killed.

See: Night Elves in Warcraft lore before they gave up their immortality for the greater good :D[/quote]
aaah warcraft reference :S
but yeah i’d do it, i have come to the terms with the fact that im gonna die and it doesnt really bother me. The only thing that does make me annoyed about death is that im not gonna get the chance to see how technology develops and continue to learn all the new things that will happen. I would just want to stay alive just to see where things lead if the world blew up, which it is likely to do eventually, then yeah we’d probably be on different planets so i could live with that but if the human race became extinct apart from me and there was no equal to it, ie intellectual conversation then i would thoroughly regret this choice

Read full topic
item.source: Would you take a dance with Immortality?

item.title: Would you take a dance with Immortality?
item.dc:creator: @g-stringer g-stringer
item.description:
@g-stringer wrote:

Mopman:

When most people speak of immortality they mean they will never die of old age, but can still kill themselves/be killed.

Then yes, I would definitely try it for a few hundred years or something.

And Jme how would one be immortal then ? Contradiction much.

Read full topic

item.title: Would you take a dance with Immortality?
item.dc:creator: @Epic_One Epic One
item.description:
@Epic_One wrote:

I would personally, but if I was to control the release, publication of the theory, and real world application; than I would not until we had the ability to populate alternate planets, along with the required travel. As overpopulation would be a massive issue, along with birth prevention - although there would be millions of moronic fundamental religious person(s) attempting to prevent it.

Read full topic
